title: Ravioli with zucchini sauce

ingredients.content: 30 g Parmesan cheese, cut into pieces (approx. 3 cm)
300 g zucchini, cut into pieces (2 cm)

preparations.content: Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and grate <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add oil, zucchini and pepper and cook <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, place a large saucepan with water and salt over high heat and bring to the boil.
Add anchovies, basil and cream to mixing bowl and blend <b>1 min/speed 5<b>- <b>10<b>, <b>increasing speed gradually from speed 5 to speed 10<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook <b>2 min/100°C/speed 2<b>. Transfer into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm.

Once water is boiling, place ravioli into saucepan and cook for 5 minutes or until al dente. Drain ravioli, then divide between serving bowls. Drizzle with zucchini sauce and sprinkle with reserved Parmesan before serving.

hintsAndTricks: To make your own ravioli, please refer to The Basic Cookbook or Everyday Cookbook for pasta dough recipe.
You can use this sauce to flavor any variety of pasta.
